name: American Medical Association University at UB Chapter
name_lowercase: american medical association university at ub chapter
description: The American Medical Association University at UB Chapter (AMA-UB-C) is led by medical students and dedicated to representing medical students.
descriptionHtml:
American Medical Association University at UB Chapter
 
The American Medical Association University at Buffalo Chapter (AMA-UB-C) is dedicated to representing medical students, improving medical education, developing leadership, and promoting activism for the health of America.

name: Biostatistics Graduate Student Association
description: Biostatistics GSA is a club organized by graduate students from department of Biostatistics at University at Buffalo and it serves the students in department of Biostatistics.

name: Dental Practice Management Club
description: PMC aims to introduce dental students to the different entrepreneurial components of a successful dental practice. By doing so, dental students can be better prepared to begin the process of owning and successfully operating a dental practice.

name: Pharmaceutical Sciences Graduate Student Association (P-GSA)
description: Pharmaceutical Sciences - Graduate Student Association
descriptionHtml: The Pharmaceutical Sciences Graduate Student Association (P-GSA) provides a voice for pharmaceutical sciences graduate students. The Pharmaceutical Sciences GSA organizes student activities and provides information concerning departmental and university-wide happenings to make your experience at UB more enjoyable. One of the important activities we sponsor is the “Alumni Symposium” where a PharmSci alumnus is invited to provide current graduate students with insights into the pharmaceutical industry, FDA, or Academia. P-GSA also sponsors annual social events such as ice skating, pumpkin carving, and bowling.

name: 411 Club
description: The 411 Club is an editorial magazine determined to create an environment for all artists to capture art in an editorial magazine form and promote/feature the talents of members. Weekly meetings will be held along with photoshoots!
descriptionHtml: Join the 411 Club and be a part of UB's newest editorial magazine! Weekly meetings and photoshoots will be held to organize and publish the issues. Bring yourself and your friends for a good time and cool people :)

name: Academic Bowl
description: Foster a friendly, academic community; compete in team and individual academic contests regionally and nationally; finally, to work to establish such competition as a means towards achieving a complete collegiate education.
descriptionHtml: UB Academic Bowl is an organization devoted to advancing intercollegiate competition as a means towards a complete, well-rounded education.  As such, we attend and host tournaments throughout the year, in which we test our knowledge of academics and popular culture against similar student organizations from the US and Canada.  We also have weekly, easygoing meetings to foster a sense of community in our members.

name: Academic Integrity
description:
The Office of Academic Integrity (OAI) at the University at Buffalo promotes the universityâ€™s
fundamental value of integrity in the academic enterprise.
descriptionHtml:
Academic integrity, the honest completion of work, is the value upon which a university is built. All members of the UB community may not understand the intricacies of academic integrity and how it is upheld at the university. The Office of Academic Integrity is here to provide education and support to instructors and students as they pursue their academic endeavors. 

 

https://vimeo.com/452701617

name: Academy of General Dentistry
description: The AGD Student Chapters introduce dental students to organized dentistry, helping them transition into practice or residency. They connect students with experienced general dentists and provide educational activities for early engagement.
descriptionHtml: The mission of the Academy of General Dentistry (AGD) Student Chapters is to introduce dental students to organized dentistry and assist them in transitioning into professional practice. Whether students are pursuing a GPR or AEGD residency or entering the workforce directly as general dentists, the program promotes continuous learning and involvement with experienced general dentists. The focus is on educational activities designed to recruit and retain dental students, helping them gain valuable early exposure to the dental field and begin their professional journey with the support of a strong community network.

name: Academy of Managed Care Pharmacy at UB
name_lowercase: academy of managed care pharmacy at ub
description: The AMCP student chapter at UB was formed in 2011 to facilitate the education, development, and promotion of the principles and practices of managed care pharmacy, which includes the practice of pharmacy within health insurance companies, PBMs, others.
descriptionHtml: The AMCP student chapter at UB was formed in 2011 to facilitate the education, development, and promotion of the principles and practices of managed care pharmacy. There are over 18,000 pharmacists working for health plans and pharmacy benefit management companies. It’s their responsibility to make sure that the plan they design provides individual patients with appropriate drugs and drug therapies, conveniently and cost-effectively. It’s a complex job, involving the expert skills of clinically trained pharmacists at every step in the patient-care process. As with pharmacists who practice in other settings, pharmacists in managed care environments are committed to ensuring that medications are used appropriately to improve patient’s health. When you join, AMCP will help you navigate the world of managed care pharmacy, build a professional network, and explore career paths!

name: Access to College Excellence Program
description: The goal of the ACE program is to provide support services to its students and offer resources needed to maximize their abilities, facilitate the transition from high school to college and ensure successful entry into an academic major at UB.

name: Accessibility Resources
description: Accessibility Resources coordinates reasonable accommodations for equitable access to UB for students with disabilities. Accessibility Resources promotes disability as diversity through their work and programming around campus.

name: Aces Club Tennis
description: Club for all fans of tennis, competitive and recreational players alike! Check in here on UB Linked and follow our Instagram at ubaces_tennis and Facebook to stay updated on all UB Aces Tennis news.
descriptionHtml:
UB Aces is the club tennis team of UB. We hit multiple times per week on the Ellicott courts and then move inside to indoor courts for weekly hitting sessions during the winter. Whether you are just a beginner at tennis or a very experienced, competitive player, you are encouraged and welcome to come hit with us. There are plenty of opportunities for competitive play as well as casual. The competitive team plays in multiple USTA tournaments against other big name schools such as Syracuse, Cornell, Rochester, Binghamton, and Albany. They also qualified for Nationals in Florida for the 2024-2025 season. Please check in on this page and follow our Instagram account, ubaces_tennis

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ubaces_tennis/

name: Acker Scholars Program
description: The University at Buffalo Daniel Acker Scholars Program is an individualized program for academically talented students who are traditionally underrepresented in higher education for an individualized academic experience. Consideration is given to
descriptionHtml:
The University at Buffalo Daniel Acker Scholars Program is an individualized program for academically talented students who are traditionally underrepresented in higher education for an individualized academic experience. Consideration is given to students with financial need, first-generation college students and underrepresented minority students (African-American, Latina/Latino American; and Native American). A supplemental application is required.

A component of the University at Buffalo Cora P. Maloney College, this unique program offers support services and activities that help students with exceptional academic potential maximize their college experience from enrollment to graduation. (Who was Daniel Acker?)

Acker Scholars have a long tradition of contributing to student leadership at UB and participating in community service. Since the first class of students enrolled in 1984, participants have gone on to complete medical, dental and law school, M.B.A.’s, and various graduate programs across the nation. Our graduates are: accountants, physicians, corporate executives, engineers, lawyers—the list goes on—and stand ready to help more students achieve their educational and career goals.

Acker Scholars come to UB as part of a community: they attend orientation together, live together, and learn from one another. This supportive, family-like atmosphere helps students develop friendships, realize their goals, get involved, and excel at UB.

name: African SA
description: Foster understanding of Africa and Pan African spirit in the University and the surrounding community. Encourage Africans as well as students from different cultures to participate in activities, meetings and provide forum for discussion of current issue
descriptionHtml: Foster understanding of Africa and Pan African spirit in the University and surrounding community. Encourage African students and students from different cultures to participate in activities, meetings, and provide forum for discussion of current issues. Assist new students with orientation and environment.

name: Africana & American Studies GSA
description: This GSA has been renamed Africana and American Studies GSA (AAS GSA) due to a departmental name change. Please stay tuned for updates. The AAS GSA serves to represent the interests and concerns of graduate students within the department.
descriptionHtml: The purpose of the Africana and American Studies Graduate Student Association (AAS GSA) shall be to provide financial and academic support to graduate students within the department. AAS GSA exists to represent the graduate students of the Africana and American Studies program to the University at large. As such, the AAS GSA aims to provide services, programming, and forums that benefit its graduate members during their matriculation here at UB. AAS GSA maintains an awareness of the impact of such programming on the success of graduate students and the development of their postgraduate careers.

name: Africana and American Studies
description: Create description here

name: Alliance Community
description: A Campus Living and Student Life sponsored Living Learning Community focused on the needs of transgender, non-binary, lesbian, gay, bisexual, and queer students and allies.
descriptionHtml: Through an intentional living/learning experience, students experience more from their on-campus residential housing. University at Buffalo living learning community participants build strong personal connections by living with like-minded peers in a community built to support and challenge them. The Alliance Living Learning Community is a community-focused program with learning goals and extra staff support.  The Alliance Living Learning Community is ideal for students wanting to embrace diversity in a safe and affirming environment that brings together LGBTQ+ students and sallies to freely explore issues of gender identity, expression, and sexual orientation.

name: Alpha Chi Sigma
description: Gamma Phi Chapter of Alpha Chi Sigma, a national, professional, co-ed chemistry fraternity.
descriptionHtml:
Alpha Chi Sigma is a national, professional, co-ed chemistry fraternity founded in 1902 with over 67,000 members, 52 collegiate chapters, 3 collegiate colonies, 9 professional chapters, and 9 professional groups. Among its notable members are Glenn Seaborg, Peter Debye, E. J. Corey, even Linus Pauling, the only person to have two Nobel prizes exclusively to himself.

The goals of Alpha Chi Sigma are simple: friendship and chemistry.  To further this, brothers participate in many activities, such as demos for National Chemistry Week, and helping with merit badge day for Boy Scouts. Even though it is a professional organization for professionals, fun must be had once in a while, including trips to local attractions, like Bisons games, or Darien Lake. There is also a biannual national conclave held at any one of the 52 collegiate chapters university.

At Gamma Phi, UB's local student group, we focus on helping eachother through our difficult and tedius course work, as well as bonding together in the muddy pits of Ooze Fest.

Exciting things are happening this year with Gamma Phi and Alpha Chi Sigma!

name: Alpha Epsilon Delta Pre-Health Honors Society - UB Chapter
name_lowercase: alpha epsilon delta pre-health honors society - ub chapter
description: Alpha Epsilon Delta (AED) is a national pre-health honor society that recognizes excellence in preprofessional health scholarship. It provides a platform for students with common interests in healthcare to connect and develop professionally.
descriptionHtml: AED is a national, pre-health honor society with 191 chapters throughout the United States. Membership in AED is an honor bestowed in recognition of superior scholastic achievement, community service, and extracurricular participation. The admissions process is intended to appreciate the accomplishments of the complete individual. AED regularly sponsors programs that allow members to learn more about their chosen profession and meet people already established in the field. In addition, AED focus upon providing its members with research and service opportunities. Participation in chapter activities is an enlightening experience that promotes the development of knowledge, initiative, and leadership.

name: Alpha Epsilon Pi
description: Alpha Epsilon Pi offers a well-rounded fraternity experience unlike any other at the University at Buffalo. Alpha Epsilon Pi is the nation's largest Jewish Fraternity and the only Jewish Fraternity at the University at Buffalo.
descriptionHtml:
The Upsilon Beta Chapter was originally chartered at UB in 1958. Since our initial chartering in 1958, our re-chartering in 2001, and our return to campus in 2025, we, the brothers of the Upsilon Beta Chapter of Alpha Epsilon Pi, have sought to provide Jewish collegiate men with an environment to prosper academically and socially.

  • BROTHERHOOD

    AEPi has a lot to offer each of its members. The first and foremost reason to join is the exceptional brotherhood that will become a cornerstone of your life. In AEPi you will make loyal friends with whom you will share your college experience and form memories that will last a lifetime.

  • PHILANTHROPY

    We are constantly striving to give back to the local community which has provided us with so much, and supported us in times of need. The Upsilon Beta chapter conducts volunteer work with many major organizations.

name: Alpha Eta Honor Society
description: Alpha Eta is the National Honor Society of the Allied Health Professions whose members represent the top ten percent of graduates of Allied Health Schools and Colleges.
descriptionHtml:
The Alpha Eta Society, Dept. of Rehabilitation Sciences, SPHHP, UB (The National Scholarship Honor Society for the Allied Health Professions)
Alpha Eta is the National Honor Society of the Allied Health Professions whose members represent the top ten percent of graduates of Allied Health Schools and Colleges. The name is derived from the Greek for the first letters of our profession, Allied (Alpha) and Health (Eta). There are 90 chapters nationwide and nearly 35,000 members that have been initiated since the beginning of Alpha Eta in 1975.The primary purpose of the Society is to recognize excellence and promote leadership and scholarship in the allied health profession. Students eligible for membership in Alpha Eta are selected annually. Students are honored at a hooding ceremony where they are presented a certificate along with a pin and cord to be worn at graduation with their regalia.

name: Alpha Kappa Alpha
description: On January 15, 1908, Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated began as a vision of nine college students on the campus of Howard University. The sorority has grown into a union of thousands of college-trained women who strive to provide service.
descriptionHtml:
On January 15, 1908, Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated began as a vision of nine college students on the campus of Howard University.  As the first African American Greek Lettered sorority, the sorority has grown into a union of thousands of college-trained women who are bound by a powerful mystique, a real moving factor in the lives of students in more than four hundred institutions of higher learning; it is one of the most solvent corporations in the world today.

 

As Alpha Kappa Alpha has grown, it has kept in balance two very important themes: the importance of the individual and strength of an organization of women of courage and ability.  As the world became more complex, there was a need for associations which cut across racial, geographical, political, physical and social barriers. Members of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated strives to maintain high scholastic standards, sisterhood, and service to all mankind.

name: Alpha Kappa Chi - UB Chapter
description: Alpha Kappa Chi is the co-educational professional environmental fraternity at the University at Buffalo.
descriptionHtml: Alpha Kappa Chi is a co-educational professional environmental fraternity whose mission is to promote the self-confidence, professionalism, and Brotherhood among member individuals in preparation for and commitment to practicing environmental sustainability.

name: Alpha Kappa Psi - Beta Iota Chapter
name_lowercase: alpha kappa psi - beta iota chapter
description: Alpha Kappa Psi is recognized as the premier developer of principled business leaders. We are the oldest and the largest Professional Co-Educational Business Fraternity.
descriptionHtml:
Alpha Kappa Psi is recognized as the premier developer of principled business leaders.

We are the oldest and the largest Professional Co-Educational Business Fraternity. It began when four prestigious students from New York University, dubbed the “Brooklyn Four,” founded Alpha Kappa Psi on October 5th, 1904.

The close-knit friends, with a passion for studying the fields of commerce, accounts, and finance, traveled to and from school daily over the Brooklyn Bridge. Their deeply enriched minds decided to begin the world's first Professional Business Fraternity to further develop their skills. Little did they know, they started a prestigious legacy that has grown to today's largest Professional Business Fraternity.

Today, Alpha Kappa Psi has over 260,000 proud members domestically and internationally. Additionally, Alpha Kappa Psi has over 260 college chapters and over 80 alumni chapters and continues to grow over the years.
orgTypeName: Department Recognized Club â€“ Invite Only Recognized Student Organizations

name: Alpha Phi Omega - UB Chapter
description: Alpha Phi Omega is a national coeducational service fraternity founded on the cardinal principles of leadership, friendship, and service. Alpha Phi Omega is open to ALL Majors. Fraternity Motto: Be a Leader, Be a Friend, Be of Service!
descriptionHtml:
Alpha Phi Omega is a National Co-Educational Service Fraternity founded on the cardinal principles of Leadership, Friendship, and Service. It provides its members the opportunity to develop leadership skills as they provide service to their campus, community, nation, and the Fraternity. We are located on over 360+ college campuses nationwide with over 400,000 alumni! 

 

Mission: Prepare students to become campus and community leaders through selfless acts of service.  

 
Purpose: Develop skills of Leadership, to promote Friendship, and provide Service to humanity.  

  

Fraternity Motto: Be a Leader, Be a Friend, Be of Service.

name: Alpha Rho Chi
description: The only national co-ed professional-social fraternity for architecture and the allied arts, APX is about Academic excellence, Leadership, Lifelong friendship, Mentorship, Inclusiveness, Diversity, Networking, Professionalism and Scholarship/awards.
descriptionHtml: As the national co-ed professional fraternity for students of Architecture and its Allied Arts, Alpha Rho Chi recognizes the importance of meeting today's challenges and tomorrow's opportunities. Every brother continues to be mindful of the fraternity's founding objectives while staying committed to service for all of those who stake in its success: our profession, universities, volunteers, members, and society.

name: Alternative Dispute Resolution Society
description: Alternative dispute resolution is an increasingly popular form of case resolution in the legal community. The ADR Society focuses on mediation, and provides multiple opportunities for students to become involved with and learn about mediation.
descriptionHtml: Alternative dispute resolution is an increasingly popular form of case resolution in the legal community. The Alternative Dispute Resolution Society concentrates mainly on mediation and provides multiple opportunities for students to become involved with and learn about the mediation process. Each year the ADR Society hosts a Representation in Mediation Competition, which allows students to enhance their skills and provides them with an opportunity to participate in mediation. Students who do well in this competition may have the chance to go on to state and international tournaments. The ADR Society provides students with networking opportunities with local mediators, as well as primes students to be good candidates for the Mediation Clinic.

name: American Association of Pharmaceutical Scientists - UB Chapter
name_lowercase: american association of pharmaceutical scientists - ub chapter
description: Our purpose is to serve its membership, the pharmaceutical sciences, the biomedical and biotechnological community, the health professions, and the interest of public health.
descriptionHtml: Our purpose is to serve its membership, the pharmaceutical sciences, the biomedical and biotechnological community, the health professions, and the interest of public health. This is accomplished by providing open forums for the exchange and dissemination of scientific knowledge by fostering the education and career growth of members and recognizing individual achievement; by influencing the formation of public policy relevant to health and related issues of public concern and, by promoting the pharmaceutical sciences as they relate to health issues of public concern.

name: American Association of Psychiatric Pharmacist Collegiate Chapter
name_lowercase: american association of psychiatric pharmacist collegiate chapter
description: The Pharmacy Students Organization for developing professional networks and expanding knowledge in the fields of Psychiatric Pharmacy and Neurologic Pharmacy.
descriptionHtml: The American Association of Psychiatric Pharmacist Collegiate Chapter (AAPP UB Collegiate Chapter) is an organization made up of professionals with the common goal of improving health outcomes for people with psychiatric and neurological disorders. Members of AAPP aim to apply specialized clinical knowledge to train healthcare professionals and provide improved patient care. The AAPP chapter started in 2017.

name: American Association of Public Health Dentistry - UB Chapter
name_lowercase: american association of public health dentistry - ub chapter
description: American Association of Public Health Dentistry (AAPHD) provides a focus for meeting the challenge to improve oral health and to provide leadership in ensuring optimal oral health for individuals and communities.

name: American Association of Women Dentists at UB
name_lowercase: american association of women dentists at ub
description: AAWD provides support and education to women dentists. We are constantly striving toward our mission of "becoming the recognized resource for connecting and enriching the lives of women dentists."

name: American Chemical Society Student Chapter - UB
name_lowercase: american chemical society student chapter - ub
description: As an official student chapter of the American Chemical Society, UBChemClub seeks to connect students through chemistry-related activities and provide relevant academic, professional, and networking opportunities.
descriptionHtml:
Alongside the UB Chemistry Department, UBChemClub aims to enrich the experiences of undergraduate students through a variety of chemistry-themed events. These activities include community engagement and outreach, professional development, and career networking. During each school year, we also gather for regular General Body Meetings and social events.

 

If you are interested in being a part of UBChemClub, please feel free to join our club Discord server below for announcements about our upcoming events, conversations on a variety of chemistry-themed topics, and more!

Chemistry Department Website:

Department of Chemistry - University at Buffalo

name: American College of Veterinary Pharmacists - UB Chapter
name_lowercase: american college of veterinary pharmacists - ub chapter
description: The mission of American College of Veterinary Pharmacists is to promote the education and leadership of pharmacy professionals in veterinary pharmacotherapy in order to enhance non-human patient care.

name: American Constitution Society at UB
description: Through a diverse, nationwide network of progressive legal students and professionals, we work to uphold the Constitution in the 21st Century by ensuring that law is a force for protecting our democracy and the public interest and for improving lives.
descriptionHtml: The American Constitution Society (“ACS”) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit educational organization. We believe that the Constitution is “of the people, by the people, and for the people” and interpret the document based on its text and against the backdrop of history and lived experience. Through a diverse nationwide network of progressive lawyers, law students, judges, scholars and many others, we work to uphold the Constitution in the 21st Century by ensuring that law is a force for protecting our democracy and the public interest and for improving people’s lives.

name: American Dental Education Association- UBSDM Chapter
name_lowercase: american dental education association- ubsdm chapter
description: ADEA Buffalo is our student chapter of a national organization concerned with academic dentistry. Each semester, we hold various lunch & learn events featuring local dentists, educators, and residents in order to promote careers in academia.
descriptionHtml:
The American Dental Education Association (ADEA) is known as "The Voice of Dental Education" and "As The Voice of Oral Health Education", whose mission is to develop an inclusive, future-ready oral health workforce prepared to improve the health of all people and communities through leadership, education and collaboration.

ADEA is the sole national organization representing 65,000+ oral health faculty, staff, administrators, student, residents, and fellows. Our members include all 87 U.S. and Canadian dental schools, more than 800 allied and advanced dental education programs, more than 50 corporations and approximately 15,000 individuals.

Our activities encompass a wide range of research, advocacy, faculty and leadership development, meetings, news and publications, including the peer-reviewed Journal of Dental Education. We also offer the dental education application services ADEA AADSAS®, ADEA PASS®, ADEA DHCAS® and ADEA CAAPID®.

ADEA also fosters interconnected community experiences that enable members to meet their individual goals while leveraging their collective strength.

Dental education is a broad and varied profession that trains people as general dentists, specialists, dental hygienists, dental therapists, dental assistants and dental laboratory technicians. ADEA membership mirrors this diversity.

ADEA members determine best practices for dental education and encourage changes in dental education programs and institutions that will benefit everyone. ADEA members come together to advocate effectively for public policy issues essential to dental educators and researchers, especially access to dental care, a necessary element to improved oral health.

Since its founding, ADEA has existed to serve the students wondering how to become a dentist, the hardworking educator training the dental professionals of the future and those striving for scientific or public policy improvements in oral health care. ADEA is incorporated as a District of Columbia nonprofit corporation and as such is subject to the District of Columbia Nonprofit Corporation Code. As established by its Articles of Incorporation, the purpose of the Association is to advance and support dental education, dental research and the dental health and education of the general public.

name: American Indian Science and Engineering Society - UB Chapter
name_lowercase: american indian science and engineering society - ub chapter
description: The American Indian Science and Engineering Society (AISES) is a national, nonprofit organization focused on substantially increasing the representation of American Indians, Alaska Natives, Native Hawaiians, Pacific Islanders, First Nations and other ind
descriptionHtml: The American Indian Science and Engineering Society (AISES) is a national, nonprofit organization focused on substantially increasing the representation of American Indians, Alaska Natives, Native Hawaiians, Pacific Islanders, First Nations and other indigenous peoples of North America in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) studies and careers.

name: American Institute of Chemical Engineers - UB Student Chapter
name_lowercase: american institute of chemical engineers - ub student chapter
description: American Institute of Chemical Engineers. To further the educational background and vocational achievement of students interested in chemical engineering; promote interests at the University at Buffalo.
descriptionHtml:
UB’s student chapter of AIChE is a club committed to encouraging academic and professional progress by providing all the necessary resources for success. The club brings students together and connects them with the Chemical and Biological Engineering (CBE) department, professors, and industry professionals. The club hosts speakers, plant tours, monthly meetings, social events, in addition to attending both the national and regional conferences and competing in the Chem-E Car competition. We have developed a mentorship program connecting the underclassman to the upperclassman within the chemical engineering department. During E-Week, we have attended the Buffalo Museum of Science during Engineers Week in order to teach kids about engineering and make them liquid nitrogen ice cream. Getting involved with the student chapter of AIChE at UB is a great way to make valuable connections, learn about the chemical industry, and have fun interacting with other Chemical Engineers. 

Join our Discord! https://discord.gg/Gczy3dy

name: American Muslim Medical Student Association
description: The American Muslim Medical Student Association (AMMSA) is a student-led organization welcoming Muslim students, physicians, and leaders to explore the inherent intersection between Islam and medicine.
descriptionHtml:
AMMSA’s goal is simple: to empower American Muslim medical students by providing opportunities for excellence in spiritual growth, professional development, and community building. 

 

Here at UB, our mission expands upon that of our national recognition - to empower non-muslim medical students with the cultural and religious knowledge necessary to make informed decisions when caring for Muslim patients.

name: American Pharmacists Association- Academy of Student Pharmacists UB Chapter
name_lowercase: american pharmacists association- academy of student pharmacists ub chapter
description: The Academy of Student Pharmacists is a division of the American Pharmacists Association (APhA). The mission of the Academy is to be the collective voice of student pharmacists, to provide opportunities for professional growth, and improve patient care.
descriptionHtml:
The organization sponsors a number of Patient Care Projects (PCPs) composed of Operation Diabetes, Operation Immunization, Operation Heart, OTC Medication Safety, Operation Substance Use Disorders, and Operation Reproductive Health.

It also hosts numerous events such as Cultural Night and Student-Faculty Auction throughout the year with its International Pharmaceutical Student's Federation (IPSF), the Policy Standing Committee (PSC), and the Inter-Professional Committee. Other networking opportunities and competitions include Mid-Year Regional Meeting (MRM), National Patient Counseling Competition (NPCC), PharmFlix Video Contest, and the National Annual Meeting and Exposition.

name: American Sign Language
description: The purpose of the American Sign Language (ASL) Club is to learn ASL or to refine one's skills. It will also be a safe space to learn more about the deaf community and come together to raise awareness and make friends.

name: American Sign Language Honor Society
description: The ASL Honor Society (ASLHS) recognizes outstanding achievements in studying American Sign Language (ASL). It promotes ASL, Deaf culture, and community involvement through scholarships, awards, and enrichment opportunities. Membership is open to student

name: American Society of Civil Engineers UB Chapter
name_lowercase: american society of civil engineers ub chapter
description: UB ASCE allows for opportunities in hands-on experience, professional networking, and overall involvement within the field of civil engineering.
descriptionHtml:
UB ASCE allows for opportunities in hands-on experience, professional networking, and overall involvement within the field of civil engineering. Our three design teams (Steel Bridge, Concrete Canoe, Seismic Design) are very competitive at the regional and national levels of competition and are always welcoming new members!

Discord: https://discord.gg/GxbsRnyMyE

Please see our website ubasce.org for up-to-date information.

name: American Society of Mechanical Engineers
description: Develop project team skills; participate in local/national projects and community service. Current projects are IAM3D(3D printed Drone), Solar Splash, Battle Bot, and Human Powered Vehicle.
descriptionHtml:
Develop project team skills; participate in local/national competitions and develop strong ties throughout the engineering community. Current projects are SOLAR SPLASH, IAM3D, BattleBots, and eHPVC!

Send us an email at ubasme@gmail.com if you're interested in joining or if you have any questions!

Add us on discord (https://discord.gg/T7VSbz3Z3c)

and follow us on Instagram (@ubasme)

name: American Student Dental Association
description: ASDA
descriptionHtml: The American Student Dental Association is a national student-run organization that protects and advances the rights, interests and welfare of dental students. It introduces students to lifelong involvement in organized dentistry and provides services, information, education, representation and advocacy.

name: Anesthesiology Interest Group
description: AIG offers members chances to learn from specialists about current topics in anesthesiology as well as explore their budding interests in the specialty with workshops and guest speakers.
descriptionHtml: The Anesthesiology Interest Group aims to expose JSMBS students to the specialty of anesthesiology through events, mentorship, research, and volunteer opportunities at the local, state, and national level.

name: Animal Advocacy and Assisted Therapies Club
name_lowercase: animal advocacy and assisted therapies club
description: AAATC will explore the interdisciplinary roles of Animal Assisted Therapies (AAT) in medicine, understand the physiological and mental health benefits of the human-animal bond, and participate in experiential learning through animal therapy events
descriptionHtml: The mission of AAATC is to explore the interdisciplinary roles of Animal Assisted Therapies (AAT) in medicine, understand the physiological and mental health benefits of the human-animal bond, and participate in experiential learning through animal therapy events. AAATC will provide opportunities for the entire JSMBS study body to become familiar with the roles of animals in goal directed treatments in the fields of medicine and healthcare, pertaining to physical, mental, emotional and/or social support. As well, the roles of animals will be discussed in the scope of scientific research and clinical medicine, and these related topics will be explored through regular journal club meetings. Students can participate in opportunities not limited to volunteering and shadowing the implementation of AAT in clinical and non-clinical settings, including hospitals and nursing homes, undergo therapy animal certification with their pet through a training program sponsored by AAATC through fundraising efforts, participate in regular wellness events and social events on and off campus. In addition, AATC aims to provide opportunities for students to participate in fundraising events to support local animal therapy organizations and sponsor families in the community in need of service animals. AAATC will provide resume-building and residency application preparation through clinical volunteer opportunities as well as contributing to research in the field of AAT.

name: Animation Production Club
description: Animation Production Club aims to create a fun space where people can learn about and how to make animations! Whether you're looking to expand your craft and portfolio through the medium-- or you're just interested in animation-- all are welcome!
descriptionHtml: In Animation Production Club, we, as both producers of art and appreciators of the medium of animation and animated works, combine our skills (no matter how much experience) to make animated projects. This includes, but is not limited to: frame-by- frame animation, motion graphics, coded animation, drawing, story boarding, character designing, background designing, color directing, voice acting, editing, music composing and more. The main purposes of this club is to act as both a recreational community to all who might love animation, and a learning environment where we can help each other hone our skills and talents-- whether you are a graphic design student wanting to learn how to utilize motion graphics in your portfolio works, or have no experience with editing and animation and would like to learn how it works. No singular member will take on the load if they don't want to! Here we can all do and learn how to do a little bit of everything if one has the willingness to learn.

name: Anthropology Club
description: The Anthropology Student Association aims to bring together undergraduate within the Anthropology department. It is comprised of students from the various subfields of Anthropology, including Cultural, Physical, Medical as well as Archaeological.
descriptionHtml: The Anthropology Student Association aims to bring together undergraduate within the Anthropology department. It is comprised of students from the various subfields of Anthropology. Which includes the subfields Cultural, Physical, Medical as well as Archaeological. However, anyone of any major can join to learn more! Join our discord to learn more about all of the fun activities and development opportunities that we are holding within the various subfields of Anthropology!

name: Anthropology Graduate Student Association
description: An organization to bring together the different subfields of anthropology and its related disciplines. We host regular social events, professional development events, and strive to serve as a united voice for graduate students of anthropology.
descriptionHtml: The Anthropology Graduate Student Association aims to bring together all graduate students housed within the Anthropology department at SUNY Buffalo. It is comprised of students from the various subfields of Anthropology, including Cultural Anthropology, Archaeology, and Biological Anthropology. We also welcome Medical Anthropology, Critical Museum Studies, and Evolution, Ecology, and Behavior MA track students. We generally meet monthly in the Anthropology graduate student lounge (479 Spaulding). We hold annual picnics, symposia, and guest lectures, among other social and professional development events.

name: Architecture Graduate Students Association
description: The Architecture Graduate Student Association's mission is to foster the development of social, academic, and professional endeavors for students in the Department of Architecture at the School of Architecture and Planning.
descriptionHtml:
The Architecture Graduate Student Association's mission is to foster the development of social, academic, and professional endeavors for students in the Department of Architecture at the School of Architecture and Planning.

Several of the ArchGSA’s yearly events include hosting various social/happy hour events for students, touring local firms, planning various career development seminars, and most popularly, an annual interdepartmental student/faculty Dodgeball Tournament.
